statement.title: Content
statement.content: Given an integer $N$  ($1 \leq N \leq 10^{13}$) and $K$ ($1 \leq K \leq 100$) co-prime numbers $P_1，P_2，...，P_k$, which are less than 1000.  Please tell me how many integers in range $[1,N]$ satisfied that none of a number in $P_1，P_2，...，P_k$ can divide it.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content:
The first line contains two integers $N$ ($1 \leq N \leq 10^{13}$) and $K$ ($1 \leq K \leq 100$).

The second line contains $K$ numbers $P_1，P_2，...，P_k$. It is guaranteed that $2 \leq P_i \leq 1000$.

It is guaranteed that the given $K$ numbers are pairwise co-prime.

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: Output an integer representing the number of integers in range $[1,N]$ satisfied the condition.

statement.title: Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
20 3 2 3 56
50 2 15 841
